Title: Project Coordinator
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Black & McDonald. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

About This Career Opportunity

Black & McDonald's Power Generation team is growing! If you are committed and collaborative professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, innovative team, this opportunity is for you.

The Project Coordinator is located in Pickering and typically reports directly to the Program Manager. The Project Coordinator is an integral member of the project team responsible for delivering modification projects of varying size and complexity. The Project Coordinator is responsible for planning, organizing, directing, and controlling project activities from start to finish according to schedule, specifications and budget, and dealing with project changes under the direction of a Project Manager (PM) & Program Manager (PgM).

Duties And Responsibilities


To plan, in conjunction with the Project Manager, to execute projects in accordance with Corporate Policy; managing all day-to-day project management
Assist the PM in the drafting and issuance of project budget, cash flow and preliminary schedule
Prepare project organization and communication charts
Support the project management team in coordinating project planning activities
Support the PM in leading the project organization and assign the work activities throughout the project lifecycle
Chair project meetings and distribute minutes to all project team members
Track the progress and quality of work being performed by design disciplines/trades
Use project scheduling and control tools to monitor projects plans, work hours, budgets, and expenditures
Prepare progress reports and issue progress schedules to clients.
Review work/contracts/WIP for areas of risk and correct deficiencies.
Effectively and accurately communicate relevant project information to the client and project team
Maintain Contract Execution Tracking Log
Track & manage contemplated change notices and change orders in the database
Prepare substantial completion certificates and ensure all required project close- out documents are obtained
Keep the Project Manager (PM) and others informed about project status and issues that may impact client relations
Work with project management team to develop tools and templates
Implement processes and procedures and conduct training sessions when necessary
Coordinate all project management, engineering, and construction activities
Support the project management team in monitoring project performance (cost, schedule, quality) and assist in completing and distributing regular project reports (including issues, status, and KPI's) to key stakeholders
Support the coordination of project close-out activities and transfer to operations
Maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders
Ensure clients' needs are met in a timely and cost-effective manner
Interface between various internal stakeholders (project services, engineering, procurement, construction, quality)
Communicate ideas for improving company processes with a positive and constructive attitude


Competency Requirements


Communicates Effectively
Customer Focus
Problem Solving and Innovation


Education Requirements


Bachelors' Degree, Diploma, Certificate or related


Work Experience Requirements


2+ years of experience as a Project Coordinator role or equivalent for nuclear power plant industry or related construction/industrial projects
Experience on projects with medium risk and complexity preferred


Skills, Abilities, And Other Requirements


Basic understanding or project management, engineering and construction processes, procedures and relevant software
Strong interpersonal, communication, organization and analytical skills
Proficient in MS Project and/or Primavera and the MS Office Suite of products
Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills
Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team based environment
Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities
A Client Security Clearance will be required


Work Perks & Benefits


Optional hybrid work model
Company paid health and dental benefits
Opportunity to participate in community and wellness initiatives
Team building events
Access to a dynamic Employee & Family Assistance Program
Opportunity for ongoing professional development
Rewards and recognition
Scholarship Program for employee dependents


APPLICATION PROCESS

Black & McDonald welcomes and encourages applications from persons with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: LPC (Virtual)
Description:
About

Licensed Professional Counselor (LPC)

Wage: Between $86-$130 an hour

Licensed Professional Counselor — Are you ready to launch or expand your private practice? Headway is here to help you start accepting insurance with ease, increase your earnings with higher rates, and start taking covered clients sooner. It’s all on one free-to-use platform, no commitment required.

About You


You’re a fully-licensed Professional Counselor at a Master’s level or above with LPC, LPCC, LCPC, LCPCS, LPCC-S licensure (accepted on a state by state basis), a valid NPI number, and malpractice insurance.
You’re ready to launch a private practice, or grow your existing business by taking insurance.


About Headway

Your expertise changes lives. Taking insurance makes it accessible to those who need it most. Every mental health provider who goes in-network with Headway supports people who’d otherwise be forced to choose between paying out of pocket, or not getting care at all. We make that process seamless — empowering you to accept insurance with ease, so you can do what you do best. So far, we’ve helped over 50,000 providers grow their practices, reaching countless people in need.

How Headway Supports Providers


Start taking insurance, stress-free: Get credentialed for free in multiple states in as little as 30 days and start seeing covered clients sooner.
Built-in compliance : Stay compliant from day one with audit support and ongoing resources.
Expansive coverage: Work with the plans that most clients use, including Medicare Advantage and Medicaid.
Increase your earnings: Secure higher rates with top insurance plans through access to our nationwide insurance network.
Dependable payments: Build stability in your practice with predictable bi-weekly payments you can count on.
Built-in EHR features : Manage your practice in one place with real-time scheduling, secure client messaging, end-to-end documentation templates, built-in assessments, and more.
Free continuing education : Nurture your long-term professional goals and earn CEUs with complimentary courses on Headway Academy.


How Headway Supports Your Clients


Increased access: Headway makes it easier for your clients to get the care they need at a price they can afford through insurance.
Instant verification: Clients can easily check their insurance status and get the care they need without disruption.


Please note: At this time, Headway can’t support mental health professionals that aren’t fully licensed. If your application was rejected for incomplete licensure, you’re welcome to reapply once you have a valid license.

About Headway

We make it easy for mental health providers to take insurance by credentialing you with the nation’s largest networks, handling billing and admin paperwork, and helping you earn more stable income with higher rates. With Headway, you can finally focus on what matters most: providing life-changing care. We’ll take care of the rest.


San Diego, California, United States


Languages


English
Show more

Title: Academy Sports Science Internship 2025
Description:
The 2025 - Academy Soccer Science Intern will assist the FC Dallas Performance staff with the daily duties.

PLEASE APPLY ONLY TO ONE INTERNSHIP POSITION!

Pay is $8.00 per hour-Non-Negotiable.

FC Dallas does not provide Visa Sponsorship for this position!

Local Candidates Only!

This internship will allow the individual to gain valuable experience with a professional organization for their future in the sports and entertainment industry. All candidate hours can be flexible to accommodate with your school or work schedule. Some nights, weekends, and holidays will be required.

What You’ll Do

Pre training:


Communicate with physical performance staff regarding daily field set up.
Coordinate GPS units for all players.


During Training


Assist performance staff on the field as needed-GPS, Strength & Conditioning.


Post Training


Organize all equipment
Download GPS, export data and communicate to performance staff.
Create daily training report and update Daily training log (players attendance sheet)
Ensure all GPS units are fully charged and ready for next day.
Connect with staff regarding end of day recap and next day planning.
All other duties as assigned.


You Are


A friendly, upbeat student wanting to work within the sports industry.
Hard-working, dedicated, and passionate about soccer.
Able to take initiative and maintain a high level of professionalism within a professional sports environment.
Deadline-driven and can work under pressure while juggling multiple projects simultaneously.
Required to work a flexible schedule to include some nights, weekends and holidays based on match schedule.


Qualifications


Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Must have a valid Driver License and clean driving record and access to your own vehicle.
Bilingual (Spanish) preferred.
Knowledge of Major League Soccer and FC Dallas


Why FC Dallas?

FC Dallas is a premier Major League Soccer (MLS) team with a commitment to innovation and creativity in sports entertainment. As part of the FC Dallas family, you’ll be working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your skills will directly impact our fan experience and brand reach.

FC Dallas is an equal opportunity employer and, therefore, pledges to provide equal op­por­­tunities without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other protected class. This pledge applies to all employees and applicants for employment in connection with the material terms and conditions of employment, including without limita­tion: recruitment, hiring, promotions, transfers, demotions, treatment during employment, bene­fits, compensation, leave of absence, training, or terminations. Supervisors who control these actions are respon­sible for fair and equal application to all employees. It is FC Dallas’s intention to comply with all federal and state equal opportunity laws and executive orders forbidding any type of discrim­in­a­tion against employees or applicants.

FC Dallas is committed to maintaining an atmosphere where all employees can perform their duties free from harassment and intimidation based on race, color, ancestry, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other protected class. Employees are encouraged to accept their share of responsibility for successfully carrying out this pledge.

Title: Data Science Internship
Description:
Welcome to SkillLab

At SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has a pathway to employment. We enable and lead a radical change - a transition towards skill-based labor and education markets. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient markets by connecting people with jobs and education through the universal language of skills. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 35+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.

SkillLab's innovative use of AI was recognised with awards like Google AI for Impact, UNESCO Top 10 uses of AI and the European Social Innovation Competition 2021, among other awards.

Your team

You will directly work with Rihab who is one of SkillLab's Senior Data Scientists. Aaron is SkillLab's Data science Lead. Furthermore, you will cooperate with the other data science team members, Anna, Nadine, and Divabelle.

We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!

Your Responsibilities


Manual data classification & curation: Classify and curate occupation and skill data, ensuring quality and preparing it for AI models
AI/ML pipeline development: Build processes for bulk data, adding quality scores and validation checks for automated classifications
Standards research & implementation: Research international taxonomy standards and best practices, analyze gaps between SkillLab taxonomies and industry standards, recommend improvements and standardization approaches, and assist in mapping between different classification systems
Taxonomy enrichment & mapping: Enrich existing taxonomies with additional metadata, create cross-references between occupation and skill categories, develop hierarchical relationships and skill clusters, and map emerging occupations and skills to existing frameworks


Your Skills


Study background in Data Science, Computational Linguistics, Information Science, or a related field
Familiarity with Python, SQL, data analysis, and visualization (using tools like pandas, matplotlib, seaborn)
Adept at statistical analysis, data exploration, pattern recognition, data cleaning, transformation, and quality assessment
Familiarity with taxonomies, ontologies, or classification systems and experience with data analysis, reporting, and visualization
Understanding of occupation classification systems (like ESCO, O*NET, ISCO), skills frameworks, competency models, labor market data, and employment terminology


Extra awesome


Hands-on experience with taxonomy management tools
Familiarity with machine learning classification processes and models
Experience in mapping and integrating diverse classification systems


Requirements


You are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don't support visa applications for applicants outside the EU
You are currently enrolled as a student or graduated within the last 12 months
You are able to commit to a six-month full-time (40 hour/week) internship


Compensation, start-Date & location


This is a paid internship. The monthly reimbursement will be 1.000 EUR
You can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to Amsterdam
We accept applications on a rolling basis and we envision a start date in September 2025


Benefits


You will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional development
You will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)
You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Alleo app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online stores
You will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like the Netherlands, Belgium etc


Our selection procedure


You apply for the role and we review your profile
We will invite you for a short screening call
We will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve you preparing a short assignment
We will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the role


What else to know?


This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and priorities
If this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!
Get 4 tips for your job application at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication
Learn what it's like to be an intern at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/whats-it-like-coffee-with-the-interns
SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds. Read more about DEI at SkillLab: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-skilllab

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Ga aan de slag als Junior Data Scientist in Utrecht! (0–2 jaar ervaring)




Ben jij analytisch sterk en wil je data omzetten in waardevolle inzichten? Wij zoeken een Junior Data Scientist die onze datasets analyseert en meewerkt aan slimme voorspellende modellen.




Wat ga je doen?

Analyseren en visualiseren van data
Bouwen en testen van machine learning-modellen
Werken met Python
Samenwerken met data-engineers en business-teams




Wat neem je mee?

HBO/WO-opleiding in data, AI, statistiek of aanverwant
Basiskennis van Python en statistische methoden
Interesse in machine learning en data-analyse
Nieuwsgierig, nauwkeurig en leergierig




Wij bieden:

Opleidings- en ontwikkelkansen
Begeleiding door ervaren data scientists
Een inspirerende hybride werkomgeving
Salarisindicatie: vanaf €3.400 per maand




Interesse? Stuur je cv en motivatie naar jsaffrie@vibegroup.com

Show more

  • Een inspirerende hybride werkomgeving
  • Salarisindicatie: vanaf €3.400 per maand


Interesse? Stuur je cv en motivatie naar jsaffrie@vibegroup.com

Title: Data Scientist - QuantumBlack, AI by McKinsey
Description:
Who You'll Work With

Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward.

In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else.

When you join us, you will have:


Continuous learning: Our learning and apprenticeship culture, backed by structured programs, is all about helping you grow while creating an environment where feedback is clear, actionable, and focused on your development. The real magic happens when you take the input from others to heart and embrace the fast-paced learning experience, owning your journey.
A voice that matters: From day one, we value your ideas and contributions. You’ll make a tangible impact by offering innovative ideas and practical solutions. We not only encourage diverse perspectives, but they are critical in driving us toward the best possible outcomes.
Global community: With colleagues across 65+ countries and over 100 different nationalities, our firm’s diversity fuels creativity and helps us come up with the best solutions for our clients. Plus, you’ll have the opportunity to learn from exceptional colleagues with diverse backgrounds and experiences.
World-class benefits: On top of a competitive salary (based on your location, experience, and skills), we provide a comprehensive benefits package to enable holistic well-being for you and your family.


Your Impact

As a Data Scientist, you will collaborate with clients and interdisciplinary teams to develop impactful analytics solutions, optimize code, and solve real-world business problems across diverse industries. You’ll grow as a technologist by contributing to cutting-edge projects, R&D, and global conferences while working alongside world-class talent in a dynamic, innovative environment.

In this role, you will partner with clients to understand their needs and develop impactful analytics solutions. You will translate business problems into analytical challenges, build models to solve them, and ensure they are evaluated with relevant metrics. You’ll also contribute to internal tools, participate in R&D projects, and have opportunities to attend and present at conferences like NIPS and ICML.

Your work will create real-world impact. By identifying patterns in data and delivering innovative solutions, you will help clients maintain their competitive advantage and transform their day-to-day operations. Your contributions will directly influence business outcomes and drive lasting improvements across industries.

You will be based in either Brussels or Amsterdam, and collaborate closely with data scientists, data engineers, machine learning engineers, designers, and product managers around the world working on interdisciplinary projects that use math, statistics, and machine learning to derive insights from raw data. You will help global companies transform their businesses and enhance performance across industries such as healthcare, automotive, energy, and elite sports.

At McKinsey, you’ll thrive in an unparalleled environment for growth. You’ll develop a sought-after perspective by connecting technology and business value, tackle real-life challenges across diverse industries, and collaborate with inspiring multidisciplinary teams, gaining a holistic understanding of AI and its potential to drive transformation.

Our Tech Stack

While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.

Your Qualifications and Skills


Bachelors, Masters or PhD level in a discipline such as: computer science, machine learning, applied statistics, mathematics, engineering or artificial intelligence.
0-2+ years of professional experience in applying machine learning and data mining techniques to real problems with copious amounts of data
Programming experience (focus on machine learning): R and/or Python (must), SPSS, SAS, Ruby, Hadoop (valued).
Ability to prototype statistical analysis and modeling algorithms and apply these algorithms for data driven solutions to problems in new domains
Ability to independently own and drive model development, balancing demands and deadlines.
Demonstrated aptitude for analytics.
While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, the PyData stack, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own open-source data pipelining framework called Kedro, Dask/RAPIDS, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP, and Azure, and more.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written, in English, with the ability to adjust your style to suit different perspectives and seniority levels. Knowledge of Dutch or French is valued.
Exceptional time management to meet your responsibilities in a complex and largely autonomous work environment.
Good presentation and communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analytical concepts to people from other fields.
Willingness to travel.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Freelance Machine Learning Engineer – NLP & LLM | Utrecht | 6 Months (with extensions)




Location: Utrecht (Hybrid)

Type: Freelance (Payroll Preferred)

Duration: 6 Months

Start Date: ASAP




Montash is urgently looking for a freelance Machine Learning Engineer to join a leading client based in Utrecht for a 6-month engagement. We're seeking a highly skilled engineer with hands-on experience in NLP, Large Language Models (LLMs), and AWS, who can hit the ground running.




Key Requirements:

Strong experience in Machine Learning, with a focus on Natural Language Processing
Practical experience working with or deploying Large Language Models (LLMs)
Proficient in AWS cloud services (SageMaker, Lambda, etc.)
Ability to work independently and contribute to production-grade ML systems
Based in or willing to work from Utrecht (hybrid/flexible on-site)
Immediate availability is essential
Payroll preferred (Dutch ZZP also considered)




Responsibilities:

Design, build, and deploy NLP-driven solutions using LLMs
Collaborate with data scientists and software engineers to integrate ML solutions
Optimize models and pipelines for performance and scalability on AWS
Deliver end-to-end solutions in a fast-paced agile environment




Interested?

If you're immediately available and this sounds like the right fit, please get in touch today with your CV and availability to shaip@montash.nl

Title: Junior Data Scientist RaboResearch - Early Career Program
Description:
This Is What We Offer You


Gross monthly salary between €3,314 and €4,733 (scale 07)
Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance
10% Employee Benefit Budget
EUR 1,400 development budget per year
Hybrid working: balance between home and office work (possible for most roles)
A pension, for which you can set the maximum amount of your personal contribution


Or view all our benefits.

Are you passionate about data and love solving complex analytical puzzles? Challenge yourself and us, and make an impact with the Data & Analytics Early Career Program at Rabobank. Grow your skills, discover your potential, and help us uncover new possibilities for Rabobank.

The role

Want to use your data skills to support the bank in meeting sustainability and climate objectives? Join RaboResearch Sustainability Data & Analytics (SuDA) team as a junior data scientist and help quantify emissions, analyze climate impact, and develop tools that drive transparency and action. You’ll collaborate with 11 professionals to deliver data and insights that will help Rabobank, and its clients meet their sustainability and climate goals.

Your work will include impactful projects such as calculating emissions intensities for financed emissions reporting, conducting research into methodologies for Greenhouse Gas Emissions calculations, and building dashboards that show climate-related data - such as progress toward SBTi targets. Your work directly supports Rabobank's sustainability goals and those of its clients.

Your primary focus:


Developing data models and visualizations for sector-and client-level emission intensities.
Research and apply methodologies for calculating Greenhouse Gas Emissions (Scopes 1, 2, and 3).
Analyze sustainability performance and develop data products that track progress toward climate targets.
Collaborating with sustainability experts and data scientists to translate insights into strategic advice.
Use your extensive knowledge in modelling, and quantitative research skills, to work in a cloud-based analytics environment.
Supporting the renewal and integration of external climate data sources into internal systems.


You and your future

During our Data & AnalyticsEarly Career Program, you’ll develop your career over 18 months by becoming an expert in your field. Throughout the program, you’ll stay with one team and receive training to enhance your hard skills. You’ll be paired with a buddy who will guide you in navigating the bank. For your personal development, you and your fellow starters will follow the Early Career Program and receive guidance from a Data & Analytics Development Consultant. We’re here to prepare you for sustainable career!

Practical


Length: 18 months, after which you will continue working within your team
Hours per week: 40


Your development as a Data & Analytics Young Professional

Within this program, you will have the opportunity to get to know yourself, your trade, and Rabobank. You will start the program in a junior position within one team, participate in (online) workshops and training modules with other young professionals, and quickly gain practical experience.

Together with Data & Analytics community there is room for creativity and initiative to organize events, training sessions, and knowledge-sharing sessions. This way, we continuously improve the program and ourselves! You will easily build a large and valuable network within the bank.

Learning From Each Other

Development is our top priority. The best way to learn is by doing, through both mistakes and successes. At Rabobank, we offer you the right balance between freedom and supervision. Develop talents you never thought you possessed, specialize in a professional field, or explore the things you're good at and enjoy doing. During your Advanced Analytics Early Career Program, you can count on us for excellent supervision. You'll work with experienced colleagues and have lots of contact with other Advanced Analytics young professionals.

Work on your own development & shape the world around you

For us, your development and that of society go hand in hand. That's why we want to invest in you and work together towards a better world. We summarize this in one sentence: "At Rabobank, you work on yourself and the world around you at the same time."

This is reflected in your personal development budget, our hybrid work environment, and a good work-life balance. You can work on banking matters for our private and business clients, but also on societal issues such as food and energy transitions.

You and your talent


Educational Background: You have obtained a Master's in (Quantitative) Economics, Econometrics, Data Science, or a similar field.
Affinity with climate, sustainability, or (Food & Agri) economics.
Work Experience: Approximately 0-2 years of work experience.
Residency: Currently living in the Netherlands.
Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to translate quantitative analysis into comprehensive information for higher management and business users.
Technical Skills: Knowledge of Python and experience in data analysis.
Language Proficiency: Excellent command of the English language.


You and the job application process

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.

So get in touch straightaway!


Questions? Contact Maria Nolten, Data scientist Sustainability RaboResearch via maria.nolten@rabobank.nl or +31887253105. Or send us a WhatsApp.
Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Maarten Wijnberg, Corporate Recruitervia maarten.wijnberg@rabobank.nl.
Interviews will be held via MS Teams.
Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our offices in Utrecht.
Assessments are part of the application process.
We look forward to meeting you in person during the selection days.
A security check is part of the process.
We respect your privacy.

We believe in the power of difference. Bringing together people's differences is what makes us an even better bank. What can you bring to Rabobank? We can't wait to hear from you.

So get in touch straightaway!

  • Questions? Contact Maria Nolten, Data scientist Sustainability RaboResearch via maria.nolten@rabobank.nl or +31887253105. Or send us a WhatsApp.
  • Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Contact Maarten Wijnberg, Corporate Recruitervia maarten.wijnberg@rabobank.nl.
  • Interviews will be held via MS Teams.
  • Interviews will be held via MS Teams or at our offices in Utrecht.
  • Assessments are part of the application process.
  • We look forward to meeting you in person during the selection days.
  • A security check is part of the process.
  • We respect your privacy.

Title: Clinical Data Scientist/ Statistician
Description:
About The Job

We are seeking a statistician with a strong interest in non-randomized study designs to join our Biometrics & Real-World Data (RWD) team. In this role, you will contribute to the design, analysis, and interpretation of studies that fall outside the traditional randomized controlled trial (RCT) framework. These include observational studies (cross-sectional and longitudinal), quasi-experimental designs (such as pragmatic trials), and single-arm studies. You will work with data generated in real-world settings—ranging from digital health tools to registries—where methodological rigor must be balanced with operational feasibility.

Your responsibilities will include developing statistical analysis plans, identifying and mitigating sources of bias and confounding, and applying appropriate methods for causal inference and sensitivity analysis. You will collaborate closely with clinical, data science, and regulatory teams to ensure that statistical deliverables are robust, transparent, and aligned with both scientific and business objectives. Experience with real-world data workflows, including quality control, documentation, and exploratory analysis, is highly valued.

At Danone, we are a global leader in health-focused food and nutrition, operating across two complementary domains


Fast-Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) we develop and market everyday nutrition products that are part of consumers’ daily lives. This includes Essential Dairy & Plant-Based Products such as Yogurts, fermented milks, and plant-based alternatives, as well as Early Life Nutrition Evidence-based infant formulas and complementary feeding solutions, grounded in over 50 years of breastmilk research.
Specialized Medical Nutrition we support individuals with specific nutritional needs due to health conditions, across all life stages. For example, Infants and Children Products for prematurity, cow’s milk allergy, faltering growth, and metabolic disorders. As well as Adults and Elderly Tailored nutrition for oncology, stroke recovery, frailty, and critical care. Finally, Clinical and Tube Feeding Oral and enteral nutrition solutions used in hospitals and home care settings.


Main Responsibilities


Study Design & Analysis Provide statistical input into protocols and analysis plans for non-randomized studies, ensuring methodological rigor and relevance to research questions.
Documentation & Review Develop and maintain statistical documents in line with internal documentation practices.
Collaboration Engage with cross-functional teams to ensure statistical considerations are integrated throughout the study lifecycle, from planning to reporting.


Key Deliverables


Protocols, Statistical Analysis Plans and Study Reports for non-randomized studies.
Well-documented and version-controlled statistical outputs, aligned with internal standards.
Input into training materials and support for statistical tools and processes.


About you

You are a collaborative and detail-oriented professional with a strong foundation in biostatistics and a passion for working with real-world data in clinical or health-related settings. You value scientific integrity and bring a proactive mindset to cross-functional environments.


MSc or PhD in biostatistics, statistics, or a related field
Experience in RWD or observational research, preferably in a clinical or health data setting
Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively across disciplines
A proactive mindset with attention to detail and a commitment to scientific integrity


About Us

At Danone we are committed to our mission “bringing health, through food to as many people as possible”. We are working together to make sure that our brands, like Nutricia and Nutrilon, create real benefits for people, communities and the planet. You will be part of one of the largest Certified B Corps™ in the world. Being B Corp means to be part of a select movement of companies verified to be meeting the highest standards of social and environmental criteria and using business as a force for good. One Planet. One Health.

Our state-of-the-art research and innovation center builds bridges between food and science and is global in reach, founded on over 125 years of experience in life & food science, technology and user experience and is at the forefront of pioneering advances in specialized nutrition.

We offer

All Danoners receive a complete package of benefits. This includes a competitive salary and yearly bonus, a premium free pension, 30 days of annual leave (with the opportunity to purchase more) and you will receive a monthly health care allowance. In addition, you can get discount on your gym membership, and we offer initiatives focused on nutrition, physical, and mental health. We provide continuous learning opportunities through workshops, online courses and training sessions.

We put people at the center of everything we do. Bring your unique perspective, ambitions and ideas to the table – the impact you could make might surprise you. We are committed to embrace diversity, nurturing an inclusive workplace where every individual is valued; Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is deeply embedded in Danone's DNA.

What's Next

It’s simple – hit the “apply” button before the application deadline of August 8th 2025. In order to comply with GDPR we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you.

Need more information? Please contact Robin Hiariej, Talent Manager via robin.hiariej@danone.com


All applications will be considered for a vacancy without discrimination based on ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

We are committed to embrace diversity, nurturing an inclusive workplace where every individual is valued; Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) is deeply embedded in Danone's DNA.

What's Next

It’s simple – hit the “apply” button before the application deadline of August 8th 2025. In order to comply with GDPR we can’t process your personal data without your given consent, so please apply directly via this website. Good luck! We can’t wait to meet you.

Need more information? Please contact Robin Hiariej, Talent Manager via robin.hiariej@danone.com

  • All applications will be considered for a vacancy without discrimination based on ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer I
Description:
Company Description

We’re Checkout.com – you might not know our name, but companies like eBay, ASOS, Klarna, Uber Eats, and Sony do. That moment when you check out online? We make it happen.

Checkout.com is where the world checks out. Our global network powers billions of transactions every year, making money move without making a fuss. We spent years perfecting a service most people will never notice. Because when digital payments just work, businesses grow, customers stay, and no one stops to think about why.

With 19 offices spanning six continents, we feel at home everywhere – but London is our HQ. Wherever our people work their magic, they’re fast-moving, performance-obsessed, and driven by being better every day. Ideal. Because a role here isn’t just another job; it’s a career-defining opportunity to build the future of fintech.

Job Description

As a Machine Learning Engineer at Checkout.com in the ML Platform team, you will contribute to the development of scalable systems that power real-time fraud detection and payment optimization. This is your opportunity to grow alongside top-tier engineers while making a tangible impact on millions of transactions globally.

The solutions that you will be building will power our stack of value added services in the Payments Performance area. We’re a growing team in an expanding area within the company and we’re looking for individuals who have strong ownership, are passionate about productionising ML and have a pragmatic approach to converting big problems into smaller iterations to constantly deliver value.

How You’ll Make An Impact


Build systems for training, deploying and monitoring machine learning models used in our payments platform, at scale
Scale our feature store to more and increasingly complex use-cases both online and offline
Deliver end to end features with full ownership under mentorship of talented engineers


Qualifications


Proficiency in writing clear, production-ready Python code
Familiarity with production ML models (online or offline) and standard MLOps practices
Familiarity with monitoring and observability of production systems, with a strong sense of ownership
Familiarity in Cloud-based application development (we use AWS)
Familiarity with one or more ML frameworks and technologies: scikit-learn, xgboost, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark, Databricks, SageMaker, Vertex AI, Kubeflow, Seldon, Triton
Strong communication skills, able to express ideas clearly and collaborate across teams
Growth mindset, always on the lookout for stretch challenges
Curiosity to tackle open-ended problems and learn from failures


Bring all of you to work

We create the conditions for high performers to thrive – through real ownership, fewer blockers, and work that makes a difference from day one.

Here, you’ll move fast, take on meaningful challenges, and be recognized for the impact you deliver. It’s a place where ambition gets met with opportunity – and where your growth is in your hands.

We work as one team, and we back each other to succeed. So whatever your background or identity, if you’re ready to grow and make a difference, you’ll be right at home here.

It’s important we set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable.

Life at Checkout.com

We understand that work is just one part of your life. Our hybrid working model offers flexibility, with three days per week in the office to support collaboration and connection.

Curious about what it’s like to be part of our team? Visit our Careers Page to learn more about our culture, open roles, and what drives us.

For a closer look at daily life at Checkout.com, follow us on LinkedIn and Instagram
Show more

Title: Data Scientist LLM
Description:
Company Description

A positive future for everyone — that’s what we’re working towards at Sopra Steria. With over 56,000 colleagues in 30 countries, we are Europe’s leading provider of digital solutions. We believe that it’s not just technology that drives transformation, but that people are at the heart of change. That’s why people are central to everything we do, both individually and as teams.

The world is shaped by how we choose to shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

We are seeking an innovative and experienced Data Scientist specialising in Large Language Models (LLMs) to join our dynamic team in Nieuwegein, Netherlands. In this role, you will be at the forefront of developing and implementing cutting-edge Natural Language Processing (NLP) solutions, bridging the gap between emerging technologies and business needs.


Design, develop, and implement advanced machine learning models, with a focus on LLMs and NLP applications
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve complex business problems using data-driven approaches
Conduct research on state-of-the-art LLM techniques and contribute to the development of novel algorithms
Preprocess and engineer features from large-scale textual datasets for NLP tasks
Optimise and deploy machine learning models in production environments
Mentor junior team members and provide technical guidance on NLP and LLM projects
Stay abreast of the latest developments in LLMs and GenAI, sharing insights with the team and clients
Contribute to the continuous improvement of our data science processes and methodologies


Qualifications


Master's degree (or equivalent experience) in a data-driven field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence, or a related discipline
Minimum of 3-4 years of hands-on experience in machine learning, with a strong focus on NLP and LLMs
Proven track record of implementing machine learning models in production environments
Advanced proficiency in Python and experience writing production-ready code
Extensive knowledge of LLMs and embeddings (e.g., GPT, BERT) and their applications
Familiarity with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Experience with NLP-specific tools and libraries (e.g., LangChain, HuggingFace, spaCy)
Proficiency in working with containerisation and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Helm, Kubernetes)
Strong understanding of CI/CD practices and version control systems (e.g., Git)
Demonstrated ability to preprocess data and engineer features for NLP tasks
Knowledge of model optimization techniques and deployment strategies
Excellent problem-solving skills and a constructive approach to challenges
Strong communication skills and ability to explain complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
Fluency in Dutch and English (both required)
Passion for staying up-to-date with the rapidly evolving NLP and LLM landscape
Collaborative mindset and enthusiasm for working in a team environment


Additional Information

You’ll be part of a major name in the tech world, known for its consulting, digital services, and software development. You’ll work alongside high-level professionals who are bold in their approach and committed to delivering exceptional results. In addition, you’ll become part of our Data area.

Within the Data area, we create long-term value for our clients through data. We help companies stay agile during transitions by making data and technology a key part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. In doing so, we help our clients stay ahead of change through the power of data. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. You’ll work in a high-tech environment focused on knowledge and innovation, with an open, no-nonsense culture that encourages initiative. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance & Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science & AI, Data Engineering & Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence — each with a clear identity and focus on content and corresponding solutions. Over 170 professionals work in this area, each in the practice that best suits their expertise and interests.

Ready for the next step in your career? We’re happy to guide you in the right direction — with offices in nearly 30 countries, we can take you places you’ve never been before. Prefer to grow internally? That’s possible too. We encourage you to keep challenging yourself and become the best version of who you are.

At Sopra Steria, we ensure you can do your job with joy and balance. That’s why we offer an attractive and flexible employment benefits package:


A permanent contract and a gross monthly salary between €3,000 and €6,000 (based on 40 hours per week). The exact amount depends on your experience and the role;
8% holiday allowance;
A generous mobility budget, including options such as an electric lease car with an NS Business Card, a lease bike, or alternative transportation that best suits your travel needs;
8% profit sharing on target (or a fixed OTB amount, depending on the role);
27 paid vacation days;
A flex benefits budget of €1,800 per year, plus an additional percentage of your salary. This can be used for things like purchasing extra vacation days or contributing more to your pension;
A home office setup with a laptop, phone, and a monthly internet allowance;
Hybrid working: from home or at the office, depending on what works best for you;
Development opportunities through training, knowledge-sharing sessions, and inspiring (networking) events;
Social activities with colleagues — from casual drinks to sports and content-driven outings;
A flexible pension scheme with customizable contributions tailored to your needs;
Option to participate in a collective health insurance plan.


Does this job sound like a match for you? Ready to help shape the world with us? Fantastic! We’re already looking forward to receiving your application.

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. Title: Deep Learning Engineer
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Design, train, validate, and deploy deep learning models using frameworks such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Collaborate with data scientists, MLOps engineers, and product teams to integrate models into scalable pipelines or production systems.
Perform model optimization (e.g., pruning, quantization) to improve latency and efficiency.
Conduct literature reviews and experiments to evaluate the latest advances in deep learning.
Develop reproducible experiments and maintain well-documented code repositories.
Contribute to architecture design for AI solutions and advise on best practices in model lifecycle management.
Participate in code reviews and knowledge-sharing sessions.

Required Skills & Experience:

3+ years of experience in deep learning or applied machine learning roles.
Strong proficiency in Python and libraries like PyTorch, TensorFlow, Keras, or JAX.
Hands-on experience with model deployment, containerization (Docker), and serving (TorchServe, TensorFlow Serving, or ONNX).
Solid understanding of deep learning architectures such as CNNs, RNNs, Transformers, etc.
Experience with data preprocessing, augmentation, and handling large datasets (image, text, or structured).
Familiarity with MLOps tools such as MLflow, Weights & Biases, or DVC.
Ability to work independently and manage project timelines and deliverables.

Preferred Qualifications:

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and GPU-based training.
Knowledge of reinforcement learning or generative models (e.g., GANs, VAEs) is a plus.
Prior experience working in regulated environments (e.g., medical imaging, finance) is an advantage.
Based in or willing to commute regularly to Amsterdam.

Title: HR Data Scientist
Description:
What are you going to do as HR Data Scientist?

Do you want to use your data skills to optimize Employee Experiences, while simultaneously helping organizations with their business performance? We are looking for people who are curious about human behavior, love data science and want to be part of the #1 People Analytics team in the BeNeLux.

As a HR Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in HR projects focusing on people themes such as Engagement, Vitality & Absenteeism, Turnover, Diversity & Inclusion, and Strategic Workforce Planning. With your data science skills, you generate insights that enable our clients to take the right decisions on these topics. These decisions and subsequent actions will lead to a superior Employee Experience for employees at our clients, while also boosting the organizational performance. 

Your work as HR Data Scientist at #Highberg

You will work for one or more renowned companies like NN Group, Jumbo Supermarkten, Friesland Campina and others. Together with your Highberg colleagues you will help our esteemed clients with generating diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive insights pertaining to People and Organizational challenges and opportunities. To generate these insights you will first combine, explore and transform data sets. Subsequently you will apply data science techniques to generate insights. Lastly, you will use your visualization and storytelling skills to make the insights compelling and actionable.

What are we asking?


You have 2-4 years of working experience
Eligible to work in the EEA without the need for visa sponsorship
Available for ≥ 4 days a week and within 1 hour’s travel of our Amsterdam RAI office
Knowledge of statistical / machine learning methods
Advanced in Python, and skilled in Azure, Databricks or other relevant tools
Proficient in English. German and Dutch are a plus
Participation in a pre-employment screening is part of our application process


Who are you?


Team-oriented, communicative, and capable of working independently
You enjoy sharing the amazing things you do with the world through case studies, social media posts, and other channels
You are ambitious
You love data science and are fascinated by human behavior


What are we offering?


Base salary ranging from EUR 3.900.- to 4.700.- per month based on your experience and skills, and excellent benefits including performance pay, provisions for mobility, pension and leave
Sincere attention to personal development including coaching by colleagues, access to and wide range of education and training and a personal development plan with matching investments
A place within a challenging and growing organization where taking personal responsibility is valued, you have the autonomy and freedom to perform your work flexibly with short lines of communication with colleagues
A pleasant working environment with an easily accessible office, and numerous social activities such as get-togethers, sports activities and team meetings
Our office is located within the Amsterdam ring and is easily accessible by public transport. While daily office attendance is not mandatory, you are always welcome to join us


About The Team

You will join the People Analytics & Research team that is part of the Organizational & Sustainability Transformation hub. A great bunch of smart and driven professionals, that will always be there for you with an idea of a helping hand! We are not only working hard together but we are also having fun together - we organize social events, and we are doing a lot of fun activities, such as getaways, Friday drinks and sport events.

We are happy to help

If you have any questions, or would like to talk further about this vacancy about opportunities within Highberg, please contact our HR team, via marleen.werkhoven@highberg.com.value:

About Highberg

Highberg originated from nine boutique consulting firms, each with best-in-class expertise in organizational, digital, and sustainability transformations. As a collective of multidisciplinary and talented boutique consulting companies, we combine our strengths to pursue one ambition: to become the leading transformation consulting group in Europe. We are proud to be a B Corp certified company, as we strive to care for our planet, society, and our employees.

Working at Highberg

At Highberg, we foster a supportive and collaborative culture. This culture is built on our three core values: Be Committed, Be Better, and Be You.
In ’Be Committed,’ colleagues tirelessly strive for a lasting positive impact on our clients, society, and the environment. We are characterized by our entrepreneurial spirit and our collective commitment to the overall success of the company.
’Be Better’ is all about our belief in continuous learning and improvement, and we provide you with opportunities to grow and develop both personally and professionally. We strive for the highest standards of quality and professionalism in everything we do.
And last but definitely not least, ’Be You’ is about encouraging you to bring your whole self to work, have fun, and embrace diversity and inclusion. We seek to establish personal connections with our clients and colleagues, building long-term, trust-based relationships.

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT QOGITA

Qogita [Ko-gi-ta] is on a mission to keep retailers competitive by modernizing how wholesale procurement is done. The team is committed to building the rails to ensure small-businesses have the ability to acquire goods at competitive prices and at ease, so they can focus on creating great customer experiences. We are one of the fastest growing B2B companies globally and are backed by top investors that have backed the likes of Facebook, Etsy, Shopify and others.

Our team is small, highly motivated and focused on delivering impact. This organization is for individuals who appreciate challenging themselves and thrive on curiosity.We operate with a flat organizational structure. All employees are expected to be hands-on and to contribute directly to the company's mission. Work ethic and strong prioritization skills are important.

Job Requirements

WHO YOU ARE


You are a student in The Netherlands who will graduate in fall of 2025 or spring of 2026 with a degree in Data Science, Engineering, Compute Science, Mathematics or a related subject.
You are ambitious and a strong communicator in English.
You are able to extract impactful insights out of (sometimes messy) real-world datasets from different sources.
You have a “get things done” attitude, and you are eager to learn and overcome any challenges to accomplish your tasks.
You have implemented projects in Python with numpy, scipy, pandas, scikit-learn, and ideally basic knowledge of SQL.
You have experience with git, Python virtual environments, and ideally, Docker containers.
You have hands-on experience with traditional ML and LLM models and know how to set up experiments and model evaluation metrics.
Experience with AWS S3, airflow, mongoDB, and integrating external APIs are a plus.


Job Responsibilities

WHAT YOU'LL BE WORKING ON

As a Data Scientist intern, you will be part of our science team. We are working on standardizing product data, market pricing, and optimal seller allocations. We will work on a project in one of those areas or explore ideas in buyer behaviour prediction, market, or seller success forecasts.

Our data platform is built on airflow, dbt, snowflake, AWS S3, mongoDB, and Kafka.

Job Benefits

PACKAGE, PERKS & BENEFITS


Paid Internship €900 gross per month.
26 days annual leave (pro-rated for the duration of the internship).
Access to an annual Learning & Development budget to grow your skills.
Office socials and the opportunity to attend our annual company-wide offsite events.
Doggo-friendly office and flexible work environment with remote options.
Potential for full-time employment opportunities.
Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Adaptfy is a turnkey data & analytics solution for the SHV family of companies. We support multiple SHV Groups with advanced Data & Analytics in all areas, elevating their operations in diverse industries across international markets and throughout entire value chains.

Adaptfy is a joint venture formed by SHV and Metyis. Metyis embodies visionary thinking in the digital world, while SHV is a globally established family of companies built on the values of integrity, trust, curiosity, passion, and inclusivity.

SHV has a presence across four continents, with businesses spanning energy, heavy lifting and transport, animal nutrition & aquaculture, testing, inspection & certification, and more. The organisation’s history reflects its courage to care—for people, for performance, and for future generations. Their success is a testament to constant reinvention through innovation.

At Adaptfy, we play a pivotal role in bringing SHV’s digital vision to life. From optimising supply chains across Europe to enhancing operational efficiency in South America, we connect the dots for SHV, shaping a data-driven future for the entire family of companies.

What We Offer


Interact with our clients on regular basis, to drive their business towards impactful change.
Work in multidisciplinary teams and learn from motivated colleagues.
A chance to take responsibility for your work, develop yourself every day and take full ownership of your career.
Become part of a fast growing international and diverse team.



What You Will Do


Perform data analysis in the field of Growth Revenue Management, Marketing Analytics, CLM/CRM Analytics and/or Risk Analytics.
Conduct analyses in typical analytical tools ranging from SAS, SPSS, Eviews, R, Python, SQL, Teradata, Hadoop, Access, Excel, etc.
Communicate analyses via compelling presentations.
Solve problems, disaggregate issues, develop hypotheses and develop actionable recommendations from data and analysis
Prepare and facilitating workshops
Manage stakeholders and communicating with executives
Coach and mentor team members



What You Will Bring


1-3 years of professional experience in the analytics domain.
An advanced degree in quantitative field (e.g. Engineering, Mathematics, etc.).
An ability to think analytically, decompose problem sets, develop hypotheses and recommendations from data analysis.
Strong technical skills regarding data analysis, statistics, and programming. Strong working knowledge of SQL, Python, R, and/or Matlab.
Ability to talk the language of statistics, finance, and economics.
Profound knowledge of the English language.



In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




As a preferred supplier to one of our biggest Financial Clients, I am seeking for an Data Scientist for a position in Utrecht, Netherlands. The successful candidate is a senior data scientist with software development experience. You will also have social impact by detecting criminal behaviour and simplifying business processes using graph analytics patterns by analysing the bank’s transactions of 8+ million customers. You will work in a team focused on enriching the enterprise knowledge graph (Neo4j) using entity matching. The team is responsible for entity matching across a range of use cases, developing and refining models to accurately identify and link related entities. You help the team in turning their innovative power and experiments into high quality production ready products, by bringing a lot of coding experience.




Practical examples

Build responsible and cost effective Graph solutions for millions of customers.
Analyse and optimize critical code to improve performance and scalability
Turn some explorational notebooks into a maintainable codebase




Top responsibilities

Create re-usable building blocks, which can be used all over the bank.
You bring experience on solving complex technical challenges and elevating the skills of those around them.
You take the lead in sharing best practices, mentoring teammates and fostering a culture of engineering excellence




Requirements:

You have a Bachelor or Master degree in Data Science, Applied Mathematics, IT or a related field
You have at least 8 or more years of experience working as a Data Scientist with strong focus on software engineering
You have strong object-oriented programming and software engineering skills, Python knowledge is a must
You are skilled in Git.
You have a passion for building and bringing to production clean, well-structured, maintainable and testable solutions.
You have experience in making components that can be re-used and standardized to support scale
You are curious by heart and experienced in collaboration with colleagues.
You communicate well in the English language (both spoken and written).
Basic understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning.
Experience with cloud platforms, preferably Azure
Experience in model deployment, performance tuning, and monitoring leveraging MLOps/DevOps is a plus.




Contract: 6+ months

Rates: Excellent

Location: Utrecht

Interview: 2 stages, 1 technical + 1 assessment




Nick Chinweerapunt

Account Manager

Gazelle Global Consulting

Tel +31 85 111 0171

Tel +44 203 588 7747

Mob +44 7377 403 773

nick@gazellegc.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Heb jij een passie voor data science én strategisch advies? Wil jij impact maken door data-inzichten te vertalen naar concrete acties? Krijg jij energie van het creëren van (Gen) AI oplossingen binnen de Retail, Finance en/of Health sector? Wij zijn op zoek naar een ervaren Data Scientist. Herken jij jezelf in onderstaand profiel? Dan willen wij graag met je in contact komen!

Bij IG&H maken we gebruik van de nieuwste data- en AI-technologieën om onze klanten te helpen innoveren. Ons team van 25 data-experts werkt nauw samen met verschillende andere expertiseteams binnen IG&H. Gezamenlijk hebben we de afgelopen jaren meer dan 40 Gen (AI)-projecten succesvol afgerond in sectoren zoals Retail, Gezondheidszorg en Financiële dienstverlening. Als Data Scientist speel jij een cruciale rol door de behoeften van klanten te begrijpen en deze te vertalen naar concrete oplossingen. Je ontwikkelt (Gen)AI-modellen en implementeert deze in de praktijk, waarbij je zakelijk inzicht combineert met diepgaande kennis van data-analyse en AI om echte waarde te creëren. Daarnaast inspireer je interne stakeholders door de nieuwste trends en ontwikkelingen op het gebied van data en AI te delen.

Wij Zoeken Iemand Die


Een bewezen trackrecord heeft als Data Scientist heeft;
Energie krijgt van het werken in multidisciplinaire projectteams;
Zowel goed zelfstandig kan werken maar ook in teams;
Een passie heeft voor Data & AI en het vermogen om zakelijke behoeften te vertalen naar impactvolle oplossingen;
Analytisch, inventief en praktisch is ingesteld.


Over Het Data & AI Team

Werken bij het Data & AI Team van IG&H Consulting is ongelooflijk divers en leuk tegelijk. Het is een geweldige plek geweest om mijn technische kennis, management consulting vaardigheden en commerciële effectiviteit te ontwikkelen. Het team is jong en ambitieus, met een sterk verlangen om complexe puzzels op te lossen, zich persoonlijk en professioneel te ontwikkelen en samen leuke activiteiten te ondernemen. Al met al is IG&H al meer dan 7 jaar een geweldige plek om te werken! Lars van Kempen - Senior Manager Data & AI

Job requirements

Wat Breng Je Mee


Jij beschikt over minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring bij (onder andere) consultancy bureaus of andere professionele dienstverleners en/of corporate Data & AI teams;
Jij hebt ervaring met het werken met Python;
Jij bent in het bezit van een Master diploma, bij voorkeur in een technisch vakgebied zoals Data Science, Computer Science, Natuurkunde, Engineering, Econometrie;
Jij hebt uitstekende mondelinge en schriftelijke communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en Engels.


Wat Wij Jou Bieden


Werken bij een Great Place To Work met een prettige sfeer, enthousiaste collega's die je ondersteunen en veel leuke activiteiten
Continue ontwikkeling via de IG&H Academy en actieve coaching on the job
Meteen een vast (onbepaald) contract
Uitstekend salaris en arbeidsvoorwaarden
Bedrijfsauto / goede mobiliteitsregeling
25 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid om er tot 5 extra op te nemen
Bonussysteem
Mogelijkheid om na 3 jaar dienstverband een sabbatical te nemen
IG&H faciliteert een Healthy Human-programma, waarbij je begeleiding krijgt bij alle aanpassingen in het leven, zoals het krijgen van een kind of het zorgen voor een ziek familielid
Mogelijkheid om parttime te werken (32 uur), minimaal 4 dagen per week
Geweldige kans om een actieve bijdrage te leveren aan de verdere groei van de organisatie
En meer, waar we graag verder op ingaan


Waarom IG&H?

IG&H transformeert toonaangevende bedrijven in de gezondheidszorg, retail en financiële sectoren. Samen met onze wereldklasse technologiepartners helpen we onze klanten vooruit te komen en relevant te blijven, met inzichtelijk advies, geweldig ontwerp en ongeëvenaarde digitale platforms. Onze uitzonderlijke resultaten komen voort uit het succesvol afstemmen van mensen, bedrijfsvoering en technologie. Met meer dan 650 getalenteerde collega’s aan boord, mensen die veranderingen en uitdagingen echt omarmen, hebben we een unieke cultuur gecreëerd die zowel hoog durft als hoog zorgt. We trekken buitengewone mensen aan en inspireren hen om de grenzen te verleggen voor zichzelf en onze klanten.

Wat betekent dat voor jou?

Enerzijds is dit, als deze vacature bij je past, een geweldige plek om te werken. We hebben zeer tevreden medewerkers en klanten (NPS > 60) en groeien met dubbele cijfers, met het oog op verdere internationale uitbreiding. We staan nog maar aan het begin van dit spannende avontuur. Waarom zou je er geen deel van uitmaken? Voor meer informatie kun je contact opnemen met ons recruitmentteam via recruitment@igh.com. Je kunt ook direct solliciteren via de sollicitatieknop. We hopen je snel te ontmoeten!

We willen dat onze medewerkers een afspiegeling zijn van de diversiteit in de samenleving. We werken samen met een opmerkelijke mix van talenten, persoonlijkheden en culturen. IG&H is trots een werkgever te zijn die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle gekwalificeerde sollicitanten worden in overweging genomen voor een dienstverband, ongeacht nationaliteit, ras, religie, geslacht, genderidentiteit of -expressie, seksuele geaardheid, genetica, handicap of leeftijd. We geven om individualiteit, maar het belangrijkste is dat we trots zijn op onze collectieve prestaties en een geweldige werkplek.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld. We werken met preferred suppliers. Stuur ons geen ongevraagde cv’s.
